derivation.yuyuan_name: mid 16th cent.: from Latin ruminat- 'chewed over', from the verb ruminari

entry.def: If you ruminate on something, you think about it very carefully.

example.ex: He ruminated on the terrible wastage that typified American life...
example.tran: 他认真地考虑了美国生活中典型的严重浪费问题。

example.ex: Obsessional personalities commonly ruminate excessively about death.
example.tran: 有强迫症的人通常过多地思考死亡的问题。

entry.def: When animals ruminate, they bring food back from their stomach into their mouth and chew it again.

example.ex: He wanted to have a look at the two oxen, both ruminating without raising their eyes.
example.tran: 他想看看那两头牛，它们都在反刍，眼睛都不抬一下。

sentences.sentence: "I mulled over the events of the afternoon"
"philosophers have speculated on the question of God for thousands of years"
"The scientist must stop to observe and start to excogitate"

auth_sentence.content: Some people ruminate about them and others don't.
auth_sentence.res_content: Some people ruminate about them and others don't.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Some people ruminate about them and others don't.

auth_sentence.content: I do not ruminate as described in the article.
auth_sentence.res_content: I do not ruminate as described in the article.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: I do not ruminate as described in the article.

auth_sentence.content: Rafsanjani was left to ruminate on the perils of moderation.
auth_sentence.res_content: Rafsanjani was left to ruminate on the perils of moderation.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Rafsanjani was left to ruminate on the perils of moderation.

sentences.en: It is worth while to ruminate over his remarks.
He is ruminating on what had happened the day before.
sentences.cn: 他在沉思前一天发生的事情。

sentences.en: As people grow older, they begin to ruminate on the uncertainty of life.
sentences.cn: 随着年龄的增长，人们开始对生活的变化无常冥思苦想。
